meanings.definition: Done, made, brought about, undertaken, etc., of one's own accord or by free choice
meanings.sent1: She chose to help him voluntarily.
meanings.sent2: He voluntarily offered to clean up the mess.
meanings.sent3: The cat voluntarily decided to chase its tail for fun.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed voluntarily, adding color to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The student voluntarily stayed after class to ask more questions.

meanings.definition: Acting or done willingly or without constraint or expectation of reward
meanings.sent1: The team members worked together voluntarily.
meanings.sent2: She voluntarily shared her snacks with her friends.
meanings.sent3: The dog voluntarily wagged its tail when it saw its owner.
meanings.sent4: The sun voluntarily brightened up the sky after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The child voluntarily hugged their parent to show love.
